BPL Be Well App User Guide

 1. Connecting your mobile phone with BPL iOxy device:
 To connect your mobile with BPL iOxy device, please follow the below steps
 a) Before connecting the BPL iOxy device to your mobile through Bluetooth, turn on the BPl iOxy device and place your finger into the slot provided. Wait until the data is displayed on BPL iOxy device’s screen post which you can establish the Bluetooth connection.
 b) Launch BPL Be Well App that is installed on your mobile.
 c) Create a personal login by Signing Up. 
 d) Add a profile by entering your personal details. 
 e) Tap on Connect to initiate Bluetooth Connection. 
 f) Allow the App to Turn On Bluetooth on your mobile device. 
 g) Tap on Search button to scan for the BPL iOxy device.
 h) Choose the ‘BPL iOxy’ from the displayed list of devices.

 After following the above steps, real time data would be displayed.

 Note: BPL iOxy device will automatically turn off if no signal is received within 10 seconds.

 2. Usage steps:
 a) After connecting your mobile to the device through Bluetooth, the data will be displayed on your BPL iOxy Application screen.
 b) After the connection, real time data of “Blood Oxygen (SPO2)”, “Pulse Rate (PR)” and “Perfusion Index (PI)” will be displayed.
 c) The application will record the monitoring results and displays with time range on your mobile phone.
 d) To start a measurement, Tap on the “START RECORDING” button. Note: Ensure that at least 40 seconds has elapsed before you press on STOP RECORDING” for a record to get saved. 
 e) To save this measurement, Tap on the “STOP RECORDING” button. The App shall generate a record which includes “report” and “trend chart”.
 Note: Multiple Users can monitor and save measurements using dedicated logins. Verify your user profile before taking measurements.

 3. Application use:
 With the help of this App, the real time results can be synchronised with the device and shown on the smart phone for a better user experience. Using the smartphone, the user information can be edited and reports can be reviewed at any point of time.
 User Info: To Edit user’s name, age, height, and weight. New Users can be added at any point of time.
 User Guide: For App usage assistance

 4. Health Parameters measured:
 a) Oxy-haemoglobin Saturation: Oxygen Saturation (SPO2) is a term which refers to the concentration of oxygen in the blood. It measures the percentage of haemoglobin binding sites in the blood stream occupied by Oxygen, which is a very important physiological parameter of respiration cycle. The normal range of blood oxygen levels is considered to be 95-100 percent. Between 90-95 percent, the blood oxygen level is considered to be low but it does not necessarily indicate any health issue.
 b) Pulse Rate: Pulse, also known as heart rate is the number of times the heart beats per minute. Normally, pulse rate and heart rate are identical. The Pulse rate range for a healthy person would be 60-90 bpm. Nervousness and an excited state of being may increase the pulse rate/heart rate.
 c) Perfusion Index: Perfusion index or PI is the ratio of the pulsatile blood flow to the non-pulsatile static blood flow in a peripheral tissue, such as fingertip, toe, or ear lobe. Perfusion Index is an indication of pulse strength at the sensor site. The PI value ranges from 0.02 percent for a very weak pulse to 20 percent for a very strong pulse. The Pi value varies depending on the users, physiological conditions, and monitoring sites. For a healthy user, the value of PI would be greater than three percent.

 5. About this software:
 BPL Be Well app is designed and developed by BPL Medical Technologies Pvt. Ltd for the device BPL iOxy. This application is compatible with mobile phones with the operating system Android 4.3 (Or above).

** Sit down and Wear the BPL iPressure as shown.\n** Relax and Switch ON the device.

1. Place the scale on a hard and flat surface. Gently step on it, and it turns on with digits display on the LED. Then step off the scale until the value on the LED displays zero. Step on it again in an upright and steady position. See the picture below for the correct standing position.

 2. The weight value on the display will flash three times. Do not read it until it stabilizes.


Converting Weight Units

 The factory default unit is kg. For unit conversion, open the battery cover at the back when power-off and adjust the gear toggle switch. The units available are kg and lb from left to right. When the switch is placed at one of the gears, the displayed unit automatically switches to the corresponding weight unit after the scale is turned on.

 The unit conversion toggle switch is located inside the battery case at the back of the scale.
Are you sure want to LogOut?

Preparation before measurement


(1) Keep your body and mood calm, take off the thicker clothes such as coat, sweater, Etc. When measuring, bare upper arm or wear thinner shirt.

(2) Users, who use APP software, need to open the Bluetooth of the device and terminal, open the APP software, and connect with the device.


When a call comes in during the measurement, the measurement will be terminated. It is recommended that Android device be set in airplane mode during measurement to avoid strong magnetism interference.
• Using Steps
 • Apply the cuff

1. Loosen the calibre of the curly cuff slightly. Place a bare arm through the cuff directly according to the instruction

2. Position the cuff 1-2cm above the elbow joint and ensure the mark on the cuff shall lie above artery.

3. Pull one end of the cuff to the lateral and tighten. The cuff should fit comfortably, yet snugly around your arm. You should be able to insert one finger between your arm and the cuff.


Body posture


Stay still and calm for five minutes before taking a blood pressure measurement. Be seated with your feet flat on the floor without crossing your legs. Place your hand palm-side up in front of you on a flat surface such as a desk or table. The cuff should be placed at the same level as your heart.


NOTE : 


Incorrect measuring posture showed as follows might cause an incorrect measurement:
 Bent over（lean forward）;
 Sitting cross-legged;
 Bend the body because of the low table or sitting on sofa.


• Measuring

• Short press (press and hold it less than 2s) the power button to turn on the device, then the cuff pressure automatically and the screen shows rising pressure values. Stay still and calm during measurement. Do not move your arm, body and the device.


• You can press the select users button “ ” to select user. If you need to change the user during measurement, short press (press and hold it less than 2s) the power button to stop the measurement. Then press the button “ ” to select user. Short press (press and hold it less than 2s) the power button again to continue the measurement.

 • Display the measurement value

• The device exhausts automatically and displays the measurement results. About the display interface of measurement results, please refer to chapter “Display ”.


• Users, who use the APP software, can read the measurement results on the software interface.

• Take off the cuff
 • Turn off the device

• Long press (press and hold it more than 2s) the power button to turn off the device after the measurement.


• NOTE :


While measuring blood pressure, the users must stay still and calm without any talk; The cuff tied on the limb shall be on the same level as the patient’s heart so as to avoid the reading error resulting from the hydrostatics effect of the blood flow between the heart and cuff. If the cuff position is higher than heart level, the BP reading will be lower, the measured result shall be added 0.75mmHg


(0.1kPa) for each centimeter higher; in case the cuff position is lower than heart level, the BP reading will be higher, the measured result shall be deducted 0.75mmHg (0.1kPa) for each centimeter lower; If the signal measurement time is more than two minutes and the device doesn’t exhaust automatically, please take off the cuff and turn off the device.


You can stop the measurement process at any time by pressing “Start/Stop” button.


Prolonged and frequent BPL iPressure BT02 measurements are associated with ischemia and neuropathy in the limb wearing the cuff. Please examine the extremities of the limb frequently for normal color, warmth and sensitivity. If any abnormality is observed, stop the BPL iPressure BT02 measurements.

Too frequent measurements may have influence on the measurement results.
Tap to Know more about BMI
According to world health Organization , the blood pressure level of your body is desirable
According to world health Organization , the blood pressure level of your body is normal
According to world health Organization , the blood pressure level of your body is pre hypertension
According to world health Organization , the blood pressure level of your body is Mild hypertension
According to world health Organization , the blood pressure level of your body is Moderate hypertension
According to world health Organization , the blood pressure level of your body is low
According to world health Organization , the blood pressure level of your body is Severe hypertension
Do you want to delete the record ?
Check whether cuff is damaged or leaky, wrap cuff correctly refer to users manual and measure again
Muscle mass index is calculated from muscle mass, body weight and height It is a quantitative assesment of health, status and strength

Protein is an important component of human cells and the organization, accounting for about 18% of the total mass of the human body. Large numbers of protein are contained in muscle cells, which is the main factors that reflect the nutritional status, physical development and health of the person being tasted

Body Age is calculated based on basal metabolism. And the basal metabolism is the comprehensive weight,body fat rate, muscle rate and other indexes. So the age of the body is a measure of the physical condition of a person who is above and below the actual age. In other words is the criteria for judging the condition of the body . Even the height and weight of the surveyors are the same, because differences in body fat and basal metabolic rate also lead to differences in age
Basal Metabolism is the minimal rate of energy expenditure unit time by animals at rest. It was measured under the circumstances when a man is awake and at complete rest
The human skeleton, composed of bones, supports the human body. Bone mineral density and calcium loss are the main concerns of bone health.
Body Water percentage, is closely related to body muscle mass, since muscle contains a large amount of water. (approx 70%)
Fat percentage is the total mass of fat divided by total body mass. It provides a better assessment for how fat or thin a person is compared to BMI

Also known as lean body weight, which is the weight of the body composition except the fat. Muscle is one of the main part of the fat body weight. The more developed the muscle is , the better physical fitness is
Visceral Fat is fat stored within abdominal cavity around a number of internal organs

 PRIVACY POLICY

At BPL MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIES PRIVATE LIMITED , a company incorporated and registered in India and having its registered office at 11th KM, Bannerghatta Road, Arakere, BANGALORE-560 076, Karnataka, India and its affiliates (“BPL Medtech”) we are committed to ensuring the privacy of every person who shares if any information with BPL Medtech. This privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) read along with the terms and conditions governing in the Agreement. 


1. ACCEPTANCE OF THE POLICY AND CHANGES TO THE POLICY 

When Users provide their Data in case needed and or applicable to us or when they click on the “I Accept” button at the end of the Terms or make use of the Application or the Services, the Users are deemed to have consented to the collection, storage, use, processing and transfer of Data in the manner as set out in this Privacy Policy.

This Privacy Policy is subject to further change. All changes to the Privacy Policy will be uploaded on this page on the Site and the same will become effective from the date the same are uploaded. Whenever the Privacy Policy is changed Users will be notified for their acceptance. The Users continued use of the Site or the Application or the Services after such changes constitute the Users acceptance of the new terms.


2. THE INFORMATION WE GATHER 

We may collect the Medical Data if required and or any Personal Data to access the Application and or avail the full range of services from BPL Medtech. BPL Medtech reserve the right to cancel or refuse the Users download and /or refuse to provide the access to the Application if it is brought to BPL Medtech notice or if it is discovered that users cannot legally binding contracts. In addition, Personal Data may include other items of information such as:

(i) Name
 (ii) Address
 (iii) Sex

(iv) Date of birth
 (v) Contact number
 (vi) Address
 (vii) Email address
 

 3. HOW WE USE THE INFORMATION WE COLLECT (“PURPOSES”) 

The Data that is collected may be used for:

(i) transmission to medical professionals / doctors for advisory services if required, 
 (ii) processing as may be required to enable the provision of advisory services, 
 (iii) storage on own or third party servers, 
 (iv) de-identification and use of the same for data analytics.
 (v) Designing and improving the Application, and Services 
 (vi) Marketing and promotion 
 (vii) Communication 


4. DISCLOSURE AND TRANSFER OF DATA 

BPL Medtech may disclose and transfer Users Data within and outside of the jurisdiction of the User in accordance with the following:

(i) We may disclose the Data to our independent contractors, vendors and suppliers including but not limited to telephone service providers, payment gateway providers, web and data hosting providers (collectively, "Outside Contractors") who are engaged to provide BPL Medtech specific services and products related to the Purposes (including services and products related to the Device).

(ii) We may make disclosures to our group companies.

(iii) We may make disclosures to third parties, in the event of a merger or acquisition, where all or a portion of BPL Medtech’s business or assets (including our associated customer lists containing Personal Data) are sold or transferred to a third party.

(iv) We may make disclosure where required by applicable law or pursuant to summons, judicial orders, governmental investigations or proceedings, or to establish or exercise the legal rights of BPL Medtech or defend against legal claims.

(v) We may make disclosures if we need to notify or assist in notifying a family member, personal representative, or another person responsible for a Users and or Consumer care and general condition.
 (vi) We along with the Outside Contractors reserve the right to utilize, modify, alter, revise, and / or develop the Data collected from the Users, without compromising with the privacy and anonymity of the User. 


5. CONSENT FOR USAGE OF DATA

User consents and permits BPL Medtech and Outside Contractors to use the Data collected for the following purposes only

(i) transmission to medical professionals / doctors for advisory services,
 (ii) processing as may be required to enable the provision of advisory services,
 (iii) storage on own or third party servers,
 (iv) de-identification and use of the same for data analytics.
 (v) Designing and improving the Application, Site and Services
 (vi) Marketing and promotion
 (vii) Communication
 (viii) Collecting and refunding payments (as may be applicable)

BPL Medtech will use User Data for the above purposes and will not use, and/or allow third parties to use the Data for a different purpose without getting User permission in advance. 

 6. SECURITY

BPL Medtech takes every effort to protect against unauthorized access to individuals' Data. All Data is protected by industry standard encryption technologies and is handled securely within BPL Medtech. Users agree and acknowledge that they are aware that BPL Medtech has implemented such security measures and that such measures are adequate for the protection of their Data.

When we share or transfer any Data in accordance with this Privacy Policy, we will undertake reasonable efforts to ensure that the transferee maintains or adopts security practices and
procedures which are at least as stringent as the security practices and procedures we follow.
While BPL Medtech will endeavor to take all reasonable and appropriate steps to keep secure any information which we hold about the Users and prevent unauthorized access, the Users acknowledge that the internet is not 100% secure and that we cannot provide any absolute assurance regarding the security of Users information over the internet. BPL Medtech will not be liable in any way in relation to any breach of security and/or unintended loss or disclosure of any information. 

 7. COOKIES

We use cookies, web beacons, web server logs and other automated means for purposes such as (i) customizing Users visits to Sites; (ii) delivering content tailored to our Users interests and the manner in which Users browse Sites; and (iii) managing Sites and other aspects of business. 

 8. LINKS TO THIRD PARTY WEB SITES

The Application may contain links to other websites and software. We are not responsible for any breach of privacy or the content of these websites or software. Please visit the privacy policy of these third party websites in order to understand their privacy and information collection practices. 

 9. ACCESS TO USER INFORMATION

If Users believes that any Users Information that BPL Medtech is holding about such User (or part thereof) is incorrect or incomplete, then Users may write to or email BPL Medtech, at this email address sales.medical@bpl.in. BPL Medtech will promptly take all reasonable efforts to incorporate the changes, and correct any information found to be incorrect. 

 10. GRIEVANCES
